===Etymology===
{{ja-etym-buddhist}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=こだいみょうおう'}} {{m|ltc|五大明王|tr=*ngǒ *dhɑ̀i *miæng *hiuɑng|lit=five great wisdom kings}}. The {{m|ltc|明王|tr=*miæng *hiuɑng||wisdom king}} portion is a translation of {{etyl|sa|ja|sort=こだいみょうおう'}} {{m|sa|विद्याराज|tr=vidyārāja||knowledge king}}.

Compare modern {{cog|cmn|五大明王|tr=Wǔ Dà Míngwáng}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|acc=6|acc_ref=DJR|ご だい みょうおう}}

===Proper noun===
{{ja-pos|proper|ご だい みょうおう}}

# the Five [[w:Wisdom Kings|Wisdom Kings]] in [[w:Vajrayana|Vajrayana Buddhism]]

====Usage notes====
When borrowed into English, this term is more often romanized as ''[[Godai Myōō]]''.
